page.title: 10NAIRN:FARMING
page.content: Since 1750,the western part of our area has been owned and farmed by Cawdor estates.There are 3 farms: Hilton of Delnies,Easter Delnies and Wester Delnies. Most of the land is flat and fertile and used for arable farming.At Easter Delnies,the main crop is barley,(kym) then triticale (a mixture of rye and oats) and finally oats(panda).The farming acreage is 206 At Wester Delnies,the main crop is peas,then barley,triticale and wheat. The acreage here is 586.The estate uses crop rotation,fertilisers and weedkillers to help the crops grow,as soils are sandy.Some land is rented out for deer & game shooting.Most hunters are German or French & pay Â£600 per deer,although they can only take the head home and the estate keeps the venison.
